Plot Densities for any assay within a SummarizedExperiment

Source: R/plotAssayDensities.R
plotAssayDensities-methods.Rd

Plot Densities for any assay within a SummarizedExperiment

plotAssayDensities(x, ...)

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
plotAssayDensities(
  x,
  assay = "counts",
  colour = NULL,
  linetype = NULL,
  trans = NULL,
  n_max = Inf,
  ...
)

Arguments

x

A SummarizedExperiment object
...

Not used
assay

An assay within x
colour

The column in colData to colour lines by
linetype

Any column in colData used to determine linetype
trans

character(1). Any transformative function to be applied to the data before calculating the density, e.g. trans = "log2"
n_max

Maximum number of points to use when calculating densities

Value

A ggplot2 object. Scales and labels can be added using conventional ggplot2 syntax. (See example)

Details

Uses ggplot2 to create a density plot for all samples within the selected assay

Examples

nrows <- 200; ncols <- 4
counts <- matrix(runif(nrows * ncols, 1, 1e4), nrows)
df <- DataFrame(treat = c("A", "A", "B", "B"))
se <- SummarizedExperiment(
  assays = SimpleList(counts = counts),
  colData = df
)
plotAssayDensities(se, colour = "treat") +
  labs(colour = "Treat")
